Summarization of Final Frontier
As the crew lands upon Earth, they end up meeting a strange man made out of shadow. Claiming to be patrolling the area for space invaders, newcomer Asier is greeted by Serpile and Emmett. Seth, on the other hand, leaves the greetings and goes on a quest for sex and medicine for Emmett. The goat, still sick out of his mind from his drinking of gasoline, ends up puking in front of both Asier and Serpile as they went to get fuel. He proceeded to go back to the ship, while the others continued forward. Serpile was able to get Asier to join the already compact ship of bounty hunters, while Seth found the temple with the accursed "artifact" he was looking for. Meanwhile, Asier and Serpile found themselves a general store. After being confused from the labyrinth of aisles that greeted them, they found out that there was in fact no fuel on the shelves. Rather, many of the fat men on motor-scooters were prepared to steal the fuel in their asses. After having found out their fuel was gone, the fat men were outraged, willing to kill both Asier and Serpile and even having the guts to put Serpile in one's ass. Emmett. after having cooked himself a home remedy of fried grass, went out to find Seth. At the temple, the two of them were obstructed by a pit. Emmett passed it with ease, and Seth fell immediately. After struggling to get out of said pit, Seth found a tunnel that lead to sexy holographic ladies. Emmett, on the other hand, was met with heads on pikes. A feisty masturbation and a stabbing of a hoof later, Asier, Emmett, and Seth find the artifact: a moldy hotdog with rotting mayonnaise. Seth eats it and a whole bunch of stone women start following the trio. They then found themselves back in the ship, crowded by stone women.
Space Rule(s) of the Episode:
Space Rule 202: Don't Trust Virgins in Temples
Space Rule 283: No Boring Adventures.

> "Ah, an adventure to be had--Oh! You're awake!"
Squemfet's father made sure his towel was tightened and picked up his son. It was easy to do so--their height difference was about one to two feet.
"Why were you soaking so early? The shower woke me up!" The boy wasn't upset, rather, his curiosity overtook him.
"Why, we're going off-planet!"
Off-planet? How exciting! Aside from the regulations that prohibited anyone under fourteen to leave Vortox-56, anything could happen.
"I have your temporary permit and everything all set up. We just need to be home by nine in the afternoon."
"Let me get ready then!" He was excited. Squemfet never knew of any way to bypass the law of the church, even it was only temporary. The man put his son down and smiled vividly.
"Praise Squoat!"
Praise Squoat indeed.
(edited)
> "Are you ready, Squon?"
His father was clad in some hunting attire, holding a high caliber laser pistol in his hand in a submissive manner. He handed it to his son without hesitation.
"In case things get hairy, I need you to carry this. Depending on the weather, the place we're going may not be safe." Squemfet nodded at his father's warning. He was a little anxious for his journey now, but he knew his squather would keep him safe.
"Let's get going before the traffic kicks in."
> "You see squon, the reason why I brought you here was to show you my inspiration. My oyster. My demi-Squoat." The kid's father was ecstatic about being here, but Squemfet was not as pleased.
"It's kind-of empty, isn't it," he inquired.
"Past that cloud barrier is our destination." The parent meant the wall of smog that protected them from the suspense abd possible horror contained within. Squemfet swallowed hard. He did not feel right being here.
> "Is this how you start your astounding books?" His dad was a highly acclaimed author in the Squoatling community.
"Indeed. Sometimes I have to tone it down out of fear of the Squingling though. He's a pain in the ass sometimes." The Squingling was the head priest of the Squoatox religion. He had full control over everything that went on in Vortox-56, along with his band of parliament.
"Hey squather, I think I found a Squoatling burial grounds." The kid shuffled his feet a bit in the dirt before walking up to a gravestone.
"Squemling Tarfoot. Didn't you know that guy?" His father fretted a bit, thinking for a moment.
"Why, he was a civil rights rebel. He was shot down for defying our Squoat." This gave an uneasy feeling in Squemfet's stomach. After looking through more graves until he found one with a small purple tulip in front of it.
"...Squemfet Tawfeek? Squather, look! It says my name!" The kid backed up as his father checked on the stone. Suddenly, the ground started to shake unnaturally.
> Squemfet, out of a sudden state of adrenaline, uppercutted the zombie off his ear and headbutted it, nearly knocking its head off. He was panting. His fur was darkening, and he was bleeding badly from his ear. But before Squemfet endured any further Crave-induced changes, his father stuck a syringe in his neck, rendering him unconscious. The father took his son out of the field and more importantly, out of the misty barrier.
> All Squemfet remembered for the rest of his day was when he woke up in bed at night. He had tubes hooked up to his neck, along with a heavily bandaged left ear. The kid didn't know what he got into on that planet. But he promised himself not to be so horrible of a shot in the future. He promised himself that he would ask for target practice. He also promised that he would never leave his father again in his own time of need.

> Nothingness. Void. Vacuum. These were all that Emmett could see as he helplessly floated away from his ship. He was lucky to even be alive. Before Seth pushed the button, Emmett found something in one of his late father's books. Titled, "The Fiends Without Squoat", there was a small present embedded in a rectangular hole in the first few pages. Labeled "Do Not Use Unless Necessary", the dead grub in the pages was meant to be crushed in one's hands, as described later in the story. Emmett crushed it right before he was discharged. His body was encompassed by an insect-like exo-skeleton. (Emmett practically looked like he was in a TRON™ suit, but with more organic and insectoid armor.) This exo-skeleton insulated him from the perilous depths of space, and in addition, respirated him with the help of an oxygen generator. The suit was old and discharged however; the power that kept him alive was leeched from his communications system.
> That was, until he saw a ship in the distance. It was not his own, but rather, a small cruiser. The vehicle was dashing towards him, to the point that he felt as if they were bound to save him. Alas, this was not the case. The small passenger ship sped past him within feet of his face, causing him to yaw clockwise. Now he was spinning on two separate planes. Delightful. It wasn't much longer until a fleet sprouted from behind the ship, obviously in pursuit. His hopes came up again. Of all the ships chasing the getaway, one of them slowed down to accommodate to Emmett's position. He was rescued. With the use of a tractor beam, the Squoatling was dragged to safety.
> "Must've been a hell of a reason why you'd be deserted from your own ship, huh?" Emmett tried to take off his helmet before realizing the anonymity it granted him.
"I was kicked out of my own ship."
"You're lucky to be alive then."
"Yeah." Emmett pushed himself up and slowly propped himself on the stranger's passenger seat.
"Are you guys chasing the speeder down?" The man patted his passenger seat and began to accelerate; the entrance from whence Emmett entered sealed itself tightly.
"This guy stole our most prized possession after gaining our trust. We're a troupe, you see." Ah, the infamous space troupes. So delicate in performance but just as dangerous and unpredictable, if not more than, a bounty hunting clan. Emmett liked how this actor was not inquisitive about his being, but rather focused on his goal. He took his place in the passenger's seat and watched as they zoomed towards their target.
"Need me to man the turrets? I've had experience."
"Look, I trust you just as much as any other stranger I pick up in the middle of space. I can't afford that artifact being blown to pieces though. Just sit tight." Emmett uncomfortably shifted in his seat, feeling unsatisfied in the moment. He decided to recollect his thoughts on his situation. Was he really in the wrong? Did he infringe on Seth's boundaries? The more he thought about it, the more guilt he felt. Maybe he shouldn't have been so upset. Maybe he should've just picked up his guardian's trash. Maybe he--

> "What's going on?!" The Kid looked up and gasped. The blue insignia on each ship told it all. It was the Llamanians. The ones who ruined his childhood. The ones who killed his parents. The ones who erradicated his home planet. After being shipped out of his vessel, Emmett knew what he must do. He couldn't hide anymore.
"Sir, do you have any firepower?" The man was in the process of requesting backup from other space troupes.
"Are you insane? That would be suicide! We need to get out of here!" At that point, The Kid took off his helmet, revealing to the ringmaster his Squoatling qualities. Emmett took a white ribbon bow and tied it around his forehead.
"This is my calling." The ringmaster nodded without further argumentation. He was knowledged in Llama-Squoat warfare, considering that it was broadcast throughout the galaxy nonstop for a week. The leader tossed Emmett a Ryno-45, a plasma-based shotgun with a higher-than-average range, along with some spare ammo.
"Anywhere you want me to launch you?" The ringmaster had a newfound confidence to him. The Squoatling put on his helmet and pointed towards the largest vessel, the mothership.
"May Squoat have mercy on us all."
> "TAKE YOUR LITTER BACK OUT OR BE SUBJECT TO EXECUTION BY THE LLAMA EMPIRE." The troupe leader then was acquainted with hundreds of other mismatched ships, overmatching the number of ships in the armada by half. Suddenly, the ships, rather than surrendering, started to fire upon the Llamas. A warzone began to form, along with casualties, powerful ship weaponry, and stray ammunition. Although Emmett's trash pile was mostly unaffected, a few beams were close to hitting him. As he reached the mothership, he latched onto it and strafed his way along a convienient ledge to a hangar bay. (Unfortunately, a banana peel did not make the journey.)
> "Hey! Don't move!" The Llamanians on his left were well armed, whereas the one on his right was trying to apprehend him. Emmett flipped off the safety of his gun and held the trigger out of view for a moment.
"I said 'Don't move'! We will shoot!" As the Llama finished speaking, Emmett aimed at two of the men on his left and released. The two of them fell, considering they were close enough to receive a concentrated blast of ultra-heated matter. The third fired at the trespasser, but the blast was absorbed by Emmett's shell. He took out the remaining two Llamas and noticed that the crevices of his apparel were now glowing green. As it turns out, the concentrated energy of the laser his opponent shot charged his armor to a functional state. Emmett took out his satchel then and quickly skimmed his father's book; he learned the suit's few enhancements through the book.
> "Hah! Imbeciles like you make me want to weep for their moronic deaths." The figure, clad in a power suit with a Llamanian insignia upon it, drew a phaseblade. The figure quickly, before Emmett could react, swiped at Emmett's side. The blade had no effect.
"Typical." The figure's blade then switched to a sharp, metallic one. She tossed him a similar weapon, insisting that he put away his gun.
"Let us dance." Emmett looked at his Ryno, and promptly aimed at her. She swiped the gun out of his hands with her sword.
"Pitiful, uncultured beast." His opponent immediately attacked, swiping at his right arm. Emmett then evaded, ducking down to grab his sword.
> "What isn't fair is your lack of civility." It slashed again, for which attack Emmett accidentally parried; he did not counter her attack. Emmett lacked any experience with a sword, however, he played along, constantly backing up to reach for his gun.
"Don't think you can get away so easily!" The being forcefully slashed into his shoulder, breaking into the shell. The kid groaned in pain, fleeing by sliding away. He grabbed his gun and hastily aimed, hitting only her non-dominant arm. The being hissed in agony.
"Oh, you want to play dirty? I can play dirty." The armored figure imitated Emmett's clumsiness, walking towards him. He backed up, having coincidentally ran out of shots in his current battery pack. As Tawfeek reached the wall, he fumbled with reloading, having dropped his sword when grabbing his gun. The being reached within a foot of him, and pressed a button on the side of her helmet before mockingly falling forward and headbutting him. The impact felt like an anvil. Emmett was certainly out for the count.
"Loser can't even defend himself."
> "Finally awake? I want to see the fear in your eyes as I behead you." This was it. He had no way to get out of this one. Emmett was too weak to break out of the bonds and he had no way to defend himself, if that mattered. He felt that paranoia from earlier. He thought of how this could've been avoided if he only took out Seth's trash. Now, his life's goal was doomed. He was doomed. The whole Squoatling race was doomed.
"Any last words?"
"I would spit on you if I could." The being laughed a little from his comment and afterwards attempted to take off his helmet. It didn't realise how tight it was on his head. Eventually, the helmet was off, and the bruised face of a defeated Squoatling with a silly white band revealed itself. The being hesitated. This hesitation was so strong, it made it drop its executioner's tool. Emmett looked to the being in its face, raising his brow a little. His executioner took off her helmet as well, showing to Emmett a white and grey collage of fur. She was another Squoatling.

"I guess no meat for me for a while." It was one of his few canines.
> "Ugh." He pulled himself up and noticed a hole in his partner's armor.
"Josephine...?" The Kid gently shook her before realizing she was out cold. Awkwardly, he pulled off the legs of her armor. In her right thigh was a wound half a centimeter in diameter; a huge bullet was in her leg.
"Damn, what happened here?" He looked around for any cutting tools, aside from her sword. (Emmett did not want to hurt her any further.) He stuck his ear to her chest to ensure she was still breathing well. As he did this, the Squoatling took our his satchel, hoping to find something. Unfortunately, the satchel was not the cure-all as he previously had thought; the only helpful thing he found was his Squoat doll.
"I think I might need to get my hooves dirty..."
> "Oh man, that's in deep." Emmett put his head up to the hole to see it better. The bullet must have been embedded at least a centimeter in her thigh. He inhaled before trying to take out the ammunition. Emmett was disgusted. He did not like this one bit. Inside, he was hurting; he felt the pain he could have been causing. After a few minutes of digging within her, he jumped.
"What the fuck, Squemfet!" Josephine bolted up, causing Emmett to fall back.
"Don't- Don't touch that... Shit." She stared at her thigh, panting.
"I was just trying to help!" Emmett was ignorant, blind to the fact that he could have potentially killed her through blood loss.
"Squemfet, don't take out bullets unless you're a doctor." She bit her lip out of agony.
"Oh..."
"Just get me something to cover it up with, will you?" He was shaking, feeling guilty from his actions.
"I'm sorry. I didn't think--" Josephine furrowed her brow.
"I know, I know! Just get me something. Please!" The Kid quickly tossed her his Squoat doll without second thought.
"Is this your Worship Do--"
"Yeah, it is. It's a little embarrassing, I know."
"I think it's cute...!" The end of her comment was met with the stinging pressure of his plush doll. Emmett kept his hands to himself, figuring that he had done enough already.
"Your doll is very personalized, you know that? Makes me a little upset to bleed on it." Josephine chuckled softly to herself.
"I was born into a rich family on Vortox," Emmett responded.
"Aristocracy? Oooh. Very nice. Always thought I would make it with a rich man." Josephine was clearly joking to lighten up the mood. She smiled over to her partner to show him that it was going to be alright.
"Always thought I would find myself a strong woman," Emmett played along.
> "I'm so glad I met you." Josephine had Emmett's Squoat doll tied to her thigh with a cloth from his shirt.
"And I you, Squosa."
"Did you just give me a nickname?"
"Oh, I'm sorry."
"Squem, you don't have or be sorry about everything, you dork." She coyly smirked at him. Emmett folded his hands together and put them in his lap.
"Sorry for being so uptight. I'm just...nervous." It was hard for her to keep in her laughs.
"What? Want to be more than friends or something?" She said this in a jokingly manner, but Josephine was solemn with her question.
"Exactly." Josephine softly sighed and stared up at the blankness of the roof. She had just met him possibly less than a day ago; it was impossible to accurately tell the time after they were knocked out.
"We're the only two left, huh?" She tilted her head towards him, resting her cheek on one of his floppy ears. Emmett slowly nodded.
"Squem." She rolled towards him and grinned. "I don't think I have much of a choice then, do I? Not that I mind the thought." Emmett sunk into his collar, smiling softly to her gorgeous blue eyes.
"Don't push it, cutie. I still need to get to know you."
> Emmett woke up from his computer desk. He had accidentally fallen asleep while searching for jobs on the Hypernet. He looked around his apartment environment, finding a rather lived-in bed, a mass of paper balls surrounding his trashcan, and two dressers. Emmett scratched his beard, having not shaved recently. Outside their room was a small hallway which led to their bathroom and general room. The Kid strode out of his seat into said room, pulled away some curtains and looked out of the tinted window. For miles, all he could see was buildings and roads, each filled to the brim with traffic. He felt exhausted. The neverending rain tended to cause that on a man who had just lost his occupation. The two Squoatlings resided in one of the tallest complexes on the planet, on the floor second to the penthouse. This was one of the benefits of Josephine's work reputation.
"Oh, how would she react?" Emmett muttered this to himself as he took out a mug and poured some of his Squodka in it; he was stressed. Soon after this, he laundered back to his room, searching endlessly for a suitable replacement.
> "Why, you're home early."
"Yeah..."
"Why's that?" The purple Squoatling took a seat in the kitchen, laying her stuff down and positioning her legs around opposing side of the chair.
"I got laid off from Vegetation Co. Apparently economy's dwindling and they can't afford me to continue working."
"What? But that's where we get our grass supply."
"I know." Thinking about the topic of grass, he took out a bundle of the green stuff and split it for the two of them to share.
"You need to get your butt up there and demand your job back."
"It's not that easy, Squosa--"
"Squem, we need the stuff. Remember the last time we ran out?" Emmett shivered. Although he had no collection of his own strength, he believed she was more monstrous than him on The Crave. A severe kick to the groin taught him to keep her filled on the plant.
"I'll go tomorrow, love."
"Furgaz gall."
"Furgaz galle." (Roughly translates to "I love you too.) Josephine rose up from her seat and licked her partner on the cheek.
"I don't know what I'd do if I lost you again."
"I promise that won't happen again. I'll find a way. Even if the veggie factory fails." The Kid reassuringly put an arm around her, sighing softly.
> "You've talked a lot in the last week," Josephine mused.
"Hey!"
"But yeah. That Seth dude?"
"My old caretaker from a GUY ago. He's finally contacted me." Emmett cut a hole in the pack and poured its contents into the skillet.
"That's nice. What did he say?"
"Well, he typed in Elfish, somehow. I translated that and it was a long message about how he wants me back." She raised an eyebrow.
"What does that mean?"
"He wants us on his ship."
"You mean you, right?"
"No, I talked to him about you and I. Apparently they brought in another Squoatling while I was gone."
"Really?"
"Yeah. All Seth told me of him was his romantic affliction with plants."
"Strange." Josephine got up and walked over to him.
"Squem, I don't think we should leave. I mean, we have a great living quarters here on Daerthlorn. I have a great job in the battle dome."
"Surprised you weren't covered in blood when you came home." She tilted her head a little.
"But look, Squosa. On this ship, we're above the law. We're able to legally hunt people down and plunder for treasure." Emmett took the skillet off of the burner and started putting some veggies on Josephine's plate.
"Isn't that dangerous? I mean, if we were to, say, be killed, our actions could cause our culture to vanish."
"We're safer in space than here. Remember, I'm always looking out for us." She rolled her eyes and jabbed a fork into a potato-like veggie.
"I hope you know what you're doing then, 'man of the house'." After she said this, Emmett took his fork, having impaled a ketchup-covered, carrot-like veggie, and smeared it on her arm playfully.
"Squem!"
> "You ready, squaby?" Josephine poked her head into the now-empty apartment cell.
"Damn, you cleaned up quickly."
"Yeah, I'm ready. Did you talk to the manager?"
"He's already selling our room as we speak!" Wow. What a time for the economy to boom. Emmett held out his free hoof for her.
"Well?" She grabbed his hand and held it tightly. Josephine was anxious. She couldn't wait to see what was out there waiting for them.
"Let's go." The two Squoatlings left the apartment in lieu towards the elevator. The outside represented hope for them. A new beginning. An escape from the sickening lifestyle of corporation and into the free and fertile regions of space.

> “Danny! Danny, wake up!”
I slowly opened my eyes to see bright ocean-blue eyes looking down on me from a perpendicular view.

“Umm, three hours before sunrise,” Adea mumbles.
“Wake me again, one hour before please,” I request.
“But Danny it’s the big day! Come on, come on!”
“What do you even plan to do while we wait for it to start?”
“I don’t know but I’m just so ready to join!”
“I know you are, but the academy isn’t going anywhere.”
“Then can you wait awake with me. Pleeeease Danny!” Adea pleaded with her large ovular eyes.
> “Fine, fine,” I comply. Even though I am a morning person, my blue sister always has too much energy for her own good. I had to learn to control my energy and convert it into useful ways, but it took GUYS with no one to help. The academy eventually helped me to use this to my advantage. Hopefully it will have the same effect on her. After all who else was going to help us. Now the time of GUY has come again when the 8 GUY olds are allowed to take the academy’s entrance exam with a chance to become some of the finest warriors on Planet Popstar. This GUY that list includes Adea, I’ve helped her train and study to ace this test after she claimed she wanted to reach the heights of a Star Warrior just like my own goal.
> Following the blue outline of Adea we walk into the expansive living room which covers about fifty square feet complete with a hundred inch TV with surround sound. The living room opened up into a clean kitchen filled with utensils and a fridge holding foods from fresh eggs from Earth and sweets found here on our home planet. The government cares for all of our expenses including the rather luxurious house my sister and I live in as well as any activities outside of the house such as sporting events and movie screenings.
“Will Hesper be coming today as well?” Adea asks out of nowhere.
“I’m not sure if she can make it today, it was hard enough for me to get a few hours off to see your ceremony. I’ll call her on the way to see, is that ok?
> Hesper, to put it bluntly, is my only friend; she is also one of the few people that have treated Adea and I nicely. Adea treats her as if she were her older sister and the two get along very well.I've known Hesper for about seven GUYS, since our entrance into the academy at eight GUYS.
Adea and I are… different from the rest of the population. While the poyo race is known mostly for its tan and pink skin tones, the small human population ranges from pale to dark brown. The poyos rarely get above four feet and ten inches and the humans are usually towering over at a minimum of five feet and 6 inches. I am expected to be done growing now that I am fifteen GUYS, but I've still grown another inch in the last 2 months, now I reach five feet and Adea is currently at 3 feet and 6 inches. The both of us, oddly enough have blue skin tones, and we don't know why, we don't even know where are parents are to ask.
> “If we're up this early, we might as well do something for the next few hours. How does training sound Adea?”
“Ugh, but I don't like training in the morning, can we do something else?”
“Nope! To the basement we go!” I yell while grabbing Adea and throwing her over my shoulder like a pack of sand.
“Sheesh, what have you been eating, boulders?” I joke.
“Hey! That's mean!” Adea yells as she pounds my back.
“Should I roll you down these stair?”
Adea froze in what one can only assume to be absolute terror. “You wouldn't.”
“Do you really want to know what I would and would not do?”
“Fine… Can we at least start with shooting?” she asked after I set her down to descend the stairs.

“You know me so well dear brother of mine.”
“Then take this,” I say as I toss her a six inch pole with a grip in the middle.
“I asked for a bow, not a pole,”
> “Before you look so dejected, wrap your fingers around the grip and thrust your arm forward” I explain.

> I just wrote this quick little story as a joke. Enjoy.
> "Squem, how much longer are they going to take? I feel like I'm melting."
"They just left a few minutes ago," responded Emmett. Emmett had a paper fan out and was fanning off his partner's face for her.
"Damn... Do we have any drinks?"
"I don't know. *Someone* stole our supply like an hour ago." He was referring to Sanya in this situation--she was drinking can after can of soda to maintain her stature as a plant. "I don't know what to tell you, Squosa."
"Is it cooler outside yet?" She had asked this question at least once already; Squosafina wanted to get out of the ship and do something. Emmett raised his eyebrow.
"You know we would burn out there," Emmett consoled. He then took off his shirt, throwing it on her face. "It's too hot for shirts right now anyways." Josephine smirked, putting the shirt down on the bed.
> "Not right now, Squosa. Maybe later."
"But it's your Squoat-given day!" The female Squoatling was right. It was his birthday, and they were spending it on the ship with nothing to do.
"Nothing sexy, if you want to please me so much." Emmett scooted over to her, licking her cheek. "Let's just keep today light-hearted, okay?" Josephine sighed from his response.
"Then what do we do?"
"Let's just chill." Squosafina, rather than to chill, hopped out of bed and started looking through her chest, located next to her dresser. "What are you doing?" She started to throw items behind her out of the chest.
"Just cleaning," Josephine replied as she tossed her sword onto the bed. Emmett immediately grabbed it and started to mess with the weapon.
"You should really teach me how to wield one of these things." Emmett slashed back and forth, causing him to press the button on the handle. Similarly to everyone else's weapons on the ship, her blade switched out for a dildo. How convenient.
"What, my sword?" She looked back and giggled at him. "I mean, I could teach you how to wield *that* instead." Emmett pressed the button again, switching the weapon to its normal state.
"I think I know how to use one of those, thank you. I meant your sword." A set of handcuffs whizzed by his face onto his lap. "Handcuffs?"
> "Help me, Squosa! They latched onto me!" Emmett exclaimed.
"You're such a dork. Meanwhile, I don't actually have the key for those." Emmett shuddered.
"Shit."
"Now you're actually helpless." Squosafina took the last item, rope, out of the chest and jumped onto the bed.
"Well, I still have my hooves to use." Planning on pranking him, Squosafina sat on his legs and took off her jacket.
"Now I can do as I please," Josephine said as seductively as she could. She took the rope and put it aside, unzipping his pants for him.
"Squosa, I said no! Get off of me!" Emmett was not amused. She pulled his pants off and threw them to the door.
"Take a load off."
"I don't want to do this." Squosafina couldn't contain her laughter; she wasn't that good of a prankster.
"You should see your face right now." Emmett groaned, now annoyed.
"You suck, you know that?"
"And you swallow, you big wuss. That's what you get for keeping me caged in here."
"I can't help that," Emmett complained.
"Your underpants are cute, you know that?" The black garment had little hopping goats throughout its perimeter.
"Get off of me please."
> "Your butt is too heavy!" Squosa stuck her tongue out at him.
"Looks like you're going to have to wait then." She then took the key to the handcuffs out of her pocket.
"You lied to me!" Emmett squirmed to get from beneath her. Purposely, she shifted more weight on his legs.
"Furgaz gall, Squem."
"Furgaz galle," Emmett muttered, laying his head back in frustration. Then and there, the door to their room opened.
"Happy birthday, Emmett!" Seth, Sanya, Hector, Iris, and Chomsky flushed into the room, surrounding him.
"Oh, fuck me," Emmett whined softly. Josephine winked as the vignette closed in on her, ending the episode.
